message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
```java
public static void main(String[] args) {
    Scanner in = new Scanner(System.in);
    ArrayList<String> words = new ArrayList<String>();
    String fileName = ""; 
    File f;
    Scanner fileIn;
    System.out.println("Please enter a file name for encryption: ");
    fileName = "Test.txt"; 
    try {
        f = new File (fileName); 
        fileIn = new Scanner (f);
        System.out.println(f.exists()); 
        int counting = 0;
        for(counting =0; fileIn.hasNext(); counting++) {
            words.add(fileIn.next());
            System.out.println(words);
        }
        PrintWriter fileOut = new PrintWriter ("Backwards.txt");
        for(int i = 0; i < words.size(); i++) {
            String word = words.get(i);
            StringBuilder encryptedWord = new StringBuilder();
            for(int j = 0; j < word.length(); j++) {
                char ch = word.charAt(j);
                if(Character.isLetter(ch)) {
                    ch += 1;
                }
                encryptedWord.append(ch);
            }
            fileOut.write(encryptedWord.toString() + " ");
        }
        fileOut.close();
    } catch(FileNotFoundException e) {
        System.out.println("Couldn't find file");
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The code reads a file and for each word in the file, it iterates over each character. If the character is a letter, it increments the ASCII value by 1. The modified characters are appended to a StringBuilder object. After all characters in a word have been processed, the StringBuilder object is converted to a string and written to the output file. The PrintWriter.write method is used to write the string to the file.

I've been stuck on this for hours and I cannot figure it out.
